EBV.EBER-ISH Staining: EBER-ISH positive; detects EBV RNA; diagnostic criteria; visualizes virus genetic material; differentiates EBV-positive cancer.
EBV.Lymphoepithelioma-like Histology: EBV-positive; lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma; large sheets; syncytial clusters; undifferentiated cells; prominent lymphoid infiltration; no glandular formation; non-keratinizing; vesicular nuclei; prominent nucleoli; desmoplastic reaction.
EBV.DNA Methylation: Hypermethylated profile; loss of normal architecture; cellular atypia; uncontrolled proliferation; higher cell density; disorganized growth; loss of differentiation; primitive cell appearance; condensed or irregular nuclei.
EBV.High frequency of PIK3CA mutations: High mitotic rates; atypical gland formation; cellular pleomorphism; increased angiogenesis; altered tumor borders; stromal fibrosis or desmoplastic reaction.
EBV.Rare TP53 mutations: Regular tissue morphology; lower cellular atypia; lower mitotic rates; potential senescence markers; normal apoptotic rates.
EBV.High frequency of ARID1A mutations: Prominent intra-tumoral lymphocytes; loss of ARID1A staining; detected by IHC; variable tumor morphology; associated with cellular pleomorphism, high mitotic activity, aggressive growth pattern.
EBV.9p24.1 amplifications: 9p24.1 amplification; PD-L1 and PD-L2 overexpression; increased TILs; non-keratinizing morphology; Reed-Sternberg cells in lymphoma; potential response to checkpoint blockade.
EBV.DNA CpG hypermethylation: Increased proliferation; high mitotic index; infiltrative tumor borders; cellular atypia; nuclear irregularity; loss of p16^INK4a expression on IHC.
EBV.EBV-encoded miRNAs: Lymphoepithelioma-like features; dense lymphoid infiltrates; variable tumor cell differentiation; prominent inflammation; EBER-positive staining on in situ hybridization.
EBV.Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes: Tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes; dispersed or clustered; infiltrating between cells or stromal; indicative of immune response.
EBV.Intraepithelial Lymphocytosis: Intraepithelial lymphocytes; small, round; dense nuclei; disrupts architecture; associated with neoplastic epithelium; stromal lymphoplasmacytic infiltration.
EBV.Stromal Lymphoplasmacytic Infiltration: Lymphocytes in stroma; plasma cells present; small cells with large nuclei; abundant basophilic cytoplasm; interspersed infiltration; reactive changes; possible fibrosis or edema.
EBV.Syncytial trabecular pattern: Syncytial trabecular pattern; nested growth; cord-like structures; indistinct cell borders; interconnected net-like structure.
EBV.Increased TIL Infiltration: Densely packed stromal lymphocytes; high nucleus-to-cytoplasm ratio; lymphocyte aggregates; tertiary lymphoid structures; sign of immune response.
EBV.Higher Levels of CD4, CD8 T Cells and T: CD4+ in periphery; CD4 stain highlighted; CD8+ within tumor; CD8 stain highlighted; Tregs by FOXP3 stain; suppress immune response.
EBV.High levels of T cell activation: High T cell activation; lymphoid aggregates; larger T cells; abundant cytoplasm; prominent nucleoli; CD69, HLA-DR, OX40, ICOS, Ki-67 expression.
EBV.Higher Levels of Immune Checkpoint Marke: PD-1 on T cells; PD-L1 on tumor/immune cells; CTLA-4 in lymphoid aggregates/invasive margins; LAG-3 on T cells; TIM-3 on T/innate immune cells.
EBV.Higher expression of anti-tumor immunity: Increased membrane staining; immune cell marker staining; dense immune stromal infiltration; organized lymphoid structures; associated inflammatory reaction.
EBV.Lace-like Pattern: Lace-like pattern; irregularly anastomosing tubules and cords; complex interconnected network; irregular net-like structure.
EBV.Lymphoid Stroma: Lymphoid stroma infiltration; “lace-like” pattern; irregular tubules and cords; immune component in microenvironment; variable lymphoid infiltration.
EBV.Neoplastic Epithelium: Neoplastic epithelium; dysplasia; increased nuclear size; hyperchromasia; prominent nucleoli; high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio; loss of differentiation; irregular glands or sheets.
EBV.Invasion into the Submucosa: Invasion into submucosa; scattered cells to clusters; neoplastic cells breach muscularis mucosae; lymphocytic response around cancer cells.
EBV.Low Rate of Lymph Node Metastasis: Low lymph node metastasis; regional lymph nodes with few or no cancer cells; disrupted lymph node architecture; pattern of replacement or expansion.
EBV.Poor Differentiation: Poorly differentiated adenocarcinomas; lacks specialized features; aggressive tumor; unformed glandular structures; infiltrating lymphoid stroma.
EBV.Epithelial Markers: Epithelial markers positive; CK7 expression reduced; confirms epithelial origin; differentiates EBVaGC from EBV-negative cancers.
EBV.Ulcered or saucer-like tumor: Central necrosis; ulceration with epithelial loss; robust inflammatory infiltrate; reactive cellular changes; marginal roll at ulcer edges; increased vascularity; surrounding fibrosis.

others.Genomic Instability: Activated RAS signaling; contributes to genomic instability; induces DNA damage; interferes with chromosome segregation; exacerbates CIN phenotype.
others.Increased Mitotic Activity: Increased mitotic rate; atypical mitotic figures; abnormal mitoses; high cellular proliferation.
others.High Mitotic Index: High number of mitotic cells; atypical mitoses; irregular mitotic figures; rapid tumor growth; increased metastasis likelihood.
others.Nuclear Pleomorphism: Variation in nuclear size and shape; nuclei size disparity; irregular nuclear shapes; oval to highly irregular forms.
others.Hyperchromasia: Nuclei appear darker; excess DNA content.
others.Irregular Nuclear Contours: Uneven nuclear borders; indented nuclear contours.
others.Prominent Nucleoli: Prominent nucleoli; increased number of nucleoli; sign of heightened protein synthesis; rapid cell division indicator.
others.Chromatin Clumping: Irregular chromatin clumping; patchy nuclear appearance.
others.Multipolar spindles: Multipolar spindles; asymmetric nuclear division; uneven genetic material distribution; cells with abnormal nuclear shapes and sizes.
others.Tumor Heterogeneity: CIN-induced genetic heterogeneity; RAS-driven proliferation of diverse cells; increased tumor complexity; potential influence on drug resistance; enhancement of metastatic potential.
others.Increased TP53 Mutations: TP53 enrichment in high-CIN tumors; link to mitotic stress; TP53 malfunctions; increased mitotic figures in histology; atypical nuclear features; increased nuclear size; irregular nuclear contours; hyperchromasia; prominent nucleoli; genomic instability; altered cell cycle regulation; variety of cell types; abnormal tumor structures.
others.Cell Proliferation: RAS pathway activation; promotes cell division; genomic instability in CIN; proliferation of abnormal cells; contributes to tumor growth; aids tumor progression.
others.Poorly Differentiated Tumor Cells: High-grade dedifferentiation; higher likelihood of metastasis.
others.Lymphovascular Invasion: Tumor cells in lymphatic vessels; tumor cells in blood vessels; direct indication of metastasis.
others.Perineural Invasion: Tumor cells invading perineural space; association with aggressive tumors; increased risk of metastasis.
others.Tumor Budding: Small clusters of cancer cells at invasive front; individual cells at invasive front; sign of aggressive tumor phenotype; correlated with metastasis.
others.Desmoplasia: Pronounced desmoplastic reaction; growth of fibrous tissue; connective tissue increase; association with aggressive tumors.
others.Depth of Invasion: Deeper gastric wall invasion; invasion into subserosal layer; invasion beyond subserosa; higher metastasis risk.
others.Correlated Lauren's Intestinal Type: Well-formed glandular structures; intestinal epithelium resemblance; chronic gastritis initiation; progression to atrophy; intestinal metaplasia; dysplasia; carcinoma development; common in high-incidence regions; environmental factor association; diet-related; Helicobacter pylori infection.
others.Increased PIK3CA mutations: PIK3CA enrichment in low-CIN tumors; increased cell growth and proliferation; high mitotic index; dense cellular arrangement; increased microvessel density in tumor stroma; variable cellular morphology and architecture; fewer apoptotic cells than expected; contributes to tumor cell invasion; aids in metastasis.
others.Reduced or Aberrant Staining for E-cadhe: Immunohistochemistry (IHC) for E-cadherin; reduced staining; absent staining; areas with CDH1 mutations; loss of protein expression.
others.Signet Ring Cells: Loss of E-cadherin function; CDH1 mutations; presence of signet ring cells; large vacuole in cells; nucleus at periphery; signet ring-like appearance; indicative of poor prognosis.
others.Loss of Cell Cohesion: Mutations in CDH1; loss of E-cadherin function; reduced intercellular adhesion; diffuse infiltration of gastric wall; isolated tumor cells; small clusters of cells; lack of glandular structures; characteristic of diffuse-type gastric cancer; Lauren's classification.
others.Altered Cell Adhesion: Claudin-18 role in cell-cell adhesion; alterations affect epithelial integrity; observed gaps between cells; loss of 'honeycomb' pattern in gastric epithelium.
others.Abnormal Cell Shapes and Arrangement: RHO gene mutations; changes in cell morphology; altered actin cytoskeleton; elongated cells; spindle-shaped cells; epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) indication; observed in GS subtype of GC.
others.Dysregulated Actin Cytoskeleton: RHO gene mutations; actin cytoskeleton alterations; affects cell shape and motility; not observable in H&E staining; irregular tumor cell arrangement; visualized with cytoskeletal markers; IHC; fluorescent stains.
